description:
The Private Endpoint creation flow consists of the creation of three related resources in the next order.

1. Atlas Private Endpoint Service
2. Aws VPC private Endpoint
3. Atlas Private Endpoint

### CREATION FLOW

The creation process waits until all the resources gets created the next order

1. Creates the Private Endpoint Service and waits until is completed (Available Status)
2. Once the Private Endpoint Service gets completed, creates the Aws VPC Private endpoint and the Atlas Private Endpoint
3. Once the two last resources gets completed (Available Status) the flow returns Success

### SIMPLIFIED CREATION FLOW

![](../docs_files/simplified_creation_flow.png)

Id.description: The unique identifier of the private endpoint service.

EndpointServiceName.description: Name of the AWS PrivateLink endpoint service. Atlas returns null while it is creating the endpoint service.

ErrorMessage.description: Error message pertaining to the AWS PrivateLink connection. Returns null if there are no errors.

InterfaceEndpoints.description: Unique identifiers of the interface endpoints in your VPC that you added to the AWS PrivateLink connection.

Status.description: Status of the AWS PrivateLink connection. Atlas returns one of the following

GroupId.description: Unique 24-hexadecimal digit string that identifies your project.

VpcId.description: String Representing the AWS VPC ID (like: vpc-xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx) (Used For Creating the AWS VPC Endpoint)

SubnetId.description: String Representing the AWS VPC Subnet ID (like: subnet-xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx) (Used For Creating the AWS VPC Endpoint)
